Package gameinterface

Class ElementManagerToolBar<T extends Element>

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JToolBar
            • gameinterface.ElementManagerToolBar<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.SwingConstants
    public class ElementManagerToolBar<T extends Element>
extends javax.swing.JToolBar
    Create an element manager as a tool bar.

    Includes the list for the different elements,
    buttons to add/remove/rearrange them,
    a viewer to inspect and modify a specific element.
    See Also:
    ControlPanel, ElementDetailPanel, Element, Serialized Form

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void addElementArray​(T element)  
      void addNewElement()
      Callback for the add button : create a new element using the addTextField's text as the element's name.
      If the name inputed is empty or already used, the method will stops and a feedback will be given to the user (the addTextField's color will be the "wrong" color defined in the ControlPanel).
      If the add is successful, the callback will also reset the addTextField's text to an empty string.
      T createElement​(java.lang.String name)
      Method to create the new element, should be override on class instanciation using an anonym class in order to use the T constructor.
      void moveDownCurrentElement()
      Callback for the down button : swap the selected element in the JList with the one below
      void moveUpCurrentElement()
      Callback for the up button : swap the selected element in the JList with the one above
      void removeCurrentElement()
      Callback for the remove button : remove the selected in the JList element of the game's element list
      void removeElementArray​(int elementIndex)  
      void setGameManager​(GameManager game)
      Connects the gameManager to the element manager.
      void swapElementArray​(int firstElementIndex, int secondElementIndex)  
      void updateDetails()
      Ask the detail panel to update its diplay only properties.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ElementManagerToolBar

        public ElementManagerToolBar​(java.lang.Class<T> eltClass,
                             ElementDetailPanel detailPanel)
        Parameters:
        elementClass - the class of elements that are gonna be managed, must be T.class
        detailPanel - the instance of detail panel used, should be an instance of the T specific derivated class of ElementDetailPanel

      • addNewElement

        public void addNewElement()
        Callback for the add button : create a new element using the addTextField's text as the element's name.
        If the name inputed is empty or already used, the method will stops and a feedback will be given to the user (the addTextField's color will be the "wrong" color defined in the ControlPanel).
        If the add is successful, the callback will also reset the addTextField's text to an empty string.
